snippet: Steven Gilchrist, a compliance examiner in the New York office of the S.E.C., was charged by federal prosecutors with making false statements about stock holdings that he wasn’t allowed to own under ethics rules.
abstract: Steven Gilchrist, a compliance examiner in the New York office of the S.E.C., was charged by federal prosecutors with making false statements about stock holdings that he wasn’t allowed to own under ethics rules.

headline.main: S.E.C. Official Charged With Making False Statements
